Text:
The duo teleport time and again in their hunt for
fresh data. Eventually they arrive in a dark cavern—
There's only one path... Is it a dead end?

Nope. I can feel a breeze coming through the gaps in
that wall.
Well, Zeta?

—Yep, just as I thought. It's gonna be tight, but we
can squeeze through. Watch your head.
Okay...
Oww...
What did I just say...

Zeta and Eta hunch down and make their way through
the gap in the wall, eventually coming upon a
slightly more open space where the cavern splits into
two paths.
Two ways forward... Which is the right one?

I don't know, but it looks like we have some wall art
now. Let's take a look...
A red cat...
...and a blue...dog?

Both of them have the same text carved beneath...
"Seek ye the path of the powerful."
A hint?

Most likely. So we're being asked which is more
powerful, the red cat or the blue dog, huh?
An odd question...
But the answer is easy.
Easy?

It's the cat, of course! N-Now c'mon, let's take the
cat's path!

Uh...are you sure? Shouldn't we think this over a
bit more?

Didn't you say that...this place is designed so that
only the intelligent may proceed?

Don't worry about all that! Everyone in the world
knows that a cat is always better than some lousy
dog!
Isn't that just...your own bias?

No, I'm serious! According to my investigations, one
in two people prefer cats to dogs, and there are
treatises stating that the cat will always win in a
head-to-head fight.
*stare*...

A-Anyway, it's totally not possible, but on the off
chance...on the million-to-one off chance that I'm
wrong, all we need to do is turn around, right?
*stare*...

Fine! I'll be honest! I will never accept a dog being
the right answer over a cat, no matter the question!
It can only be spite on the part of the author! Now
let's go!

I did come up with my own answer...but if you feel
that strongly about it...I can humor you...

Eta gives in to Zeta's forceful entreaty, and the two
embark upon the left path.
We've come quite a long way...but there's nothing...

My body tells me we've been walking for five minutes
or so, but yeah, nothing. The path continues onward,
so it may be further ahea—
*gasp*
Oh.

With a rumble, the ground below them collapses. Zeta
quickly leaps to safety, but Eta is slow to react...
Uh-oh...
Eta tumbles into the pitfall that opens beneath her.
Eta?! Damn, a trap!!!
It...It's all because I chose this path! Eta?!
Eta! Eta! Say something if you can hear me—
Eta's voice can be heard faintly from the pit.
I can hear you...
Eta?! Y-You're alright?!
I'm...hanging on...
Wha... Hanging on?

Eta has managed to stop her fall partway down the pit
by creating a wrench out of slime and plunging it
into the wall.
*sway*...

Hurry up and save me... My arms...are on fire... And
the slime...isn't stable...

She made a slime wrench and stuck it in the wall,
huh... Whew...

...Wait, this is no time to be relieved! I'll be
right there!
Whew... Thought I was a goner...

Sorry. I lost my cool back there... But after that
spine-chilling experience, I've got it back.

It's okay... I understand it was...a delicate
matter...

With Eta now safe, she and Zeta return to the
chamber with the pictures.

You said you came up with your own answer, so let's
hear it.

What's drawn and written here...has no bearing on the
question.
What matters are...the colors and conjecture.
The colors?

First...our circumstances. The cave is dark, so it's
hard to identify which color is which.
I see...

This next part is conjecture, but red is often used
as a warning, while green or blue are used to
represent safety...

Master Shadow also mentioned something about red
meaning "stop" and blue meaning "go."
Hmm...

And thus we have my answer...although it's just a
theory.

But I am a scientist. I draw my conclusions based
on cues from the environment, experience,
knowledge, and all possibilities.

And if I'm proven wrong, all the better. I'll simply
use that lesson the next time I encounter a similar
situation.
Eta...
...Why are you looking at me like that?

...I'm just realizing how little I know about you.
We almost never go on missions together, so getting
to see a little bit of who you are feels new to me.

You're much more logical than I had thought. You can
also be crazy at times...but I suppose that's also
part of the package with your rational mindset.
Hm? Was that an insult?
Haha, you're imagining things.

I'm gonna go with your theory about this riddle.
I mean, it's probably fine anyway since the other
path already proved to be no good.
Okay, the path of the dog it is...

...Another fork in the road. There's more wall art
here too, so I take it we made the right choice?
What is it this time?

The picture depicts a single minecart and a set of
tracks with a fork branching off. Proceeding along
the tracks leads to five people, while at the end
of the fork there is one person...
This is a...minecart puzzle?

If the cart keeps going straight there will be five
casualties. But if it switches tracks, only one
person dies. So it's a question of choosing
whether to sacrifice the life of one for the many.

Doesn't seem like the answer will come easy, but what
do you think, Eta?

I knew my answer the moment I saw it...but I'd like
to hear your thoughts too...

My thoughts? Okay... Since the inevitable
outcome is five deaths, and one person makes it out
alive if the cart continues going straight...

I suppose I wouldn't do anything and just let fate
run its course. I tried using my intuition this time.
...How'd I do?

Not bad. Everyone has their own way of seeing things,
so I won't reject yours...
And what's your answer?

Mine...takes into account the "quality," not
"quantity" of people. For example, if I were in that
cart, I believe the right choice would be the path
where I survive.

I think of my knowledge and talents as assets to the
world. So it's...natural...that others of little
worth...might lose their lives in place of mine.
Quality, eh...

I'm also considering the nature of the person who
created this riddle...since Laugus and I...share a
few things in common...

Hmm... Guess that's how you big-brain scientists see
the world, huh.

In short...all lives are not equal. Great knowledge
and ability are of value to the world. So—
Eta's expression grows unusually serious.

If, supposing...my life were weighed against that of
Master Shadow...I believe I would be obligated to
forfeit my existence without hesitation.
Uh...
Do you...dislike this line of thinking?
...Heheh.

...No, I don't. What you said now just made me
realize that I'd make the same choice if such a time
ever came.

You know what...I think I like you. I want to make
you one of my underlings. What do you say?
...Sounds annoying.

Haha, aw, you're no fun. But enough about that—
Let's choose a path...
Agh?!
What's this light—
A sudden burst of light swallows the pair up—
